body.p: At first, Belle resented the Beast for keeping her father away. She was a stubborn woman with big dreams, so being couped up inside all day was miserable. The Beast, who didn’t handle rejection well, often butted heads with her and projected his insecurities. Afraid he would be alone forever and convinced no one could love a beast, he acted as animalistic as possible. , deep down inside, he wanted Belle to accept him. Despite showering her with fancy dinners, chocolates, flowers, and clothes, Belle rejected everything.

The talking objects within the castle believed Belle could love the Beast and break the spell. They became determined to make it happen. With the support of Cogsworth the clock, Lumiere the candelabra, Mrs. Potts the teapot, and Armoire the wardrobe, the Beast designed a custom library for Belle. This was the start of something new – as the enchanted rose withered, their friendship blossomed. Luckily for the Beast, Belle was willing to give him a second chance.
